ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Excellent course that every chemist should take. It exposes you to useful transformations that every chemist should have in their toolbox.
yes, best graduate class I have taken. the class is an excellent introduction of the area of synthetic methodology.
Transition metal catalyzed organic chemistry with some organocatalysis. I would recommend it to any student interested in organic/organometallic chemistry.
Would definitely recommend for any student who plans to do synthetic organic chemistry
I would definitely recommend this class. It provides a great overview over metallorganic chemistry, the basic mechanisms and applications in industry and academia.
good course to get to know various catalytic reactions.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This class exposed me to a toolbox of reactions which are currently being used by industry to develop compounds that I will gladly use in my graduate career.

It gave me a better understanding of applications of transition metal catalyzed chemistry in the industry and certain aspects of transition metal catalyzed chemistry and organocatalysis that I was unfamiliar with. The course material will definitely help with my research in organometallics.
Writing a proposal was a very valuable experience.
doing final project, writing proposal, helped me a lot to practice writing, thinking about how to realize imagining idea.
